pullRequest.title: [NETBEANS-4881] Automatically detect & list Payara Platform version in the server registration panel
pullRequest.bodyText:
This is a feature PR, providing support to parse the Payara Enterprise & Community Server version and dynamically fetch the latest available artifacts of Payara Server from https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/fish/payara/distributions/payara/maven-metadata.xml.
Metadata XML only contains the list of Payara Server Community artifact versions which will be listed (except Beta and Alpha version) in the download combo-box during the registration of the Payara Server in the Apache NetBeans.

commit.message: Automatically detect & list Payara Server version from Apache NetBeans IDE
NETBEANS-4881 Automatically list Payara Micro version

nodes.bodyText: Is this an unnecessary change just adding empty space at the end of the line?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -503,7 +503,7 @@ meth public final void setName(java.lang.String)
 meth public final void setPriority(int)
 meth public final void stop()
  anno 0 java.lang.Deprecated()
-meth public final void stop(java.lang.Throwable)
+meth public final void stop(java.lang.Throwable)

nodes.bodyText:
Changing enum to normal class? That is binary incompatible change. Now there are two options:

do the change in a compatible way
properly document/label/version an incompatible change

In case you want to evolve enum to non-enum in a compatible way, read this essay. It can be done, but just changing to class ServerDetails isn't the right approach.

 hfds LOGGER,RESTART_DELAY,support
 
-CLSS public final !enum org.netbeans.modules.payara.common.ServerDetails

nodes.bodyText: Removing from list of friends is an incompatible API change.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -71,7 +80,7 @@
                 </test-type>
             </test-dependencies>
             <friend-packages>
-                <friend>org.netbeans.modules.payara.cloud</friend>
+                <friend>org.netbeans.modules.payara.micro</friend>

nodes.bodyText:
To keep compatibility one would have to:

keep the public enum PayaraVersion
make it implement Comparable
Introduce new (package private) class PayaraVersionImproved
extract common functionality into interface PayaraVersionApi
make both enum and "improved" class implement the API interface
Expanding list of friends, constitutes an API change and has to be properly versioned. See friend dependencies essay.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -169,6 +169,7 @@
                 <friend>org.netbeans.modules.android.maven</friend>
                 <!-- danis@netbeans.org -->
                 <friend>org.vaadin.netbeans.maven</friend>
+                <friend>org.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling</friend>

commit.message: Merge branch 'FISH-253' of https://github.com/jGauravGupta/netbeans into FISH-253
[NETBEANS-4881] PayaraVersion & ServerDetails enum compatible API added

nodes.bodyText:
Alas, to be binary backward compatible, you have to keep the old method signature and introduce new method:
PayaraPlatformVersionAPI getVersionApi()

You can choose the method name, of course. Technically it would even be getVersion(), but you are going to have problems to compile Java source that contains two methods without arguments with different return types.

commit.message: [NETBEANS-4881] Set the HTTP based Admin Interface
[NETBEANS-4881] Payara Tooling compatible API added in signature
